research.name: Music X Lab, NYU Shanghai
research.summary: Implemented hardware and software solutions for haptic music tutoring systems. Conducted pilot studies to gather feedbacks, based on which the team and I iterated on both the experiment design, and the device and system implementation.

work.name: CS Department, UW-Madison
work.summary: Research Assistant for People and Robots Lab, with Dr. Bilge Mutlu.

work.name: CS Department, UW-Madison
work.summary: Teaching Assistant for CS354: Machine Organization and Programming.

work.name: Van Robotics
work.summary: Started as a Full Stack Engineer. Design and implement the high-level software architecture of the smart robot tutor ABii; Work with research team to perform data analysis, implement machine learning models, as well as deploying the models to edge devices in real-world settings.

work.name: Music X Lab, NYU Shanghai
work.summary: Implemented hardware and software solutions for haptic music tutoring systems. Conducted pilot studies to gather feedbacks, based on which the team and I iterated on both the experiment design, and the device and system implementation.

work.name: IQVIA (former IMS Health and Quintiles)
work.summary: Develop various Excel models; significant VBA codes used both to enhance user experience, and to compute model outputs (Epidemic/Monte Carlo models).

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Computer Sciences Summer Fellowship 2022
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Robots in Family Routines: Development of and Initial Insights from the Family-Robot Routines Inventory
publications.publisher: 2024 33rd IEEE International Conference on Robot and Human Interactive Communication (ROMAN)
publications.award: Finalist: Pioneering Research Award in Robot and Human Interactive Communication

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
